intro: Oreosyce aspera, commonly known as the rough oreosyce, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four petals, and it produces small, round fruits. Oreosyce aspera is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
